page.title: 11THE FIRE STATION
page.content: There are 19 personnel who contribute to the running of{Wymondham Fire {Station},all on a voluntary basis. This team includes 1 Station Officer, 1 Sub-officer,4 Leading Firemen and 13 Firemen. All men must live or work locally and be able to give day-time cover between 9 a.m. and 5 p.m. The team operates on a shift basis so that the 2 fire engines are manned 24 hours a day. When an alarm is given from the Central Station in Norwich, the Wymondham personnel are immediately notified by means of a pocket alerter. They should take no more than 4 minutes to leave the Station.In 1984 they were alerted 287 times,an average of 5 times a week. The fire engines that are used are continually being updated, although the equipment carried remains basically the same.
